mainwrap.TEXT: kṛtvā vidhim imaṃ bhaktyā vidyādānaphalaṃ labhet ||1.1||
yasya yāvad bhaved vittaṃ sa tasyehānusārataḥ |

apparatuswrap.TR:
As many letters are in the manuscript of the knowledge of Śiva,
so many thousand years the donor will live in the town of Śiva.

mainwrap.TEXT: daśa pūrvān samuddhṛtya daśa vaṃśyāṃś ca paścimān |

apparatuswrap.APP: 4b vaṃśyāṃś NC45NK82GP74; vaṃśāś NKA12NK28NKo77E, vaśyāṃś GP43

apparatuswrap.TR:
Having rescued ten ancestors and ten descendants,
having brought to Heaven [his] mother, father and lawful wife,
he will attain Śiva.

Surrounded by his queens, accompanied by all [his] servants, the king,
through the power of the gift of knowledge, will go to the town of Śiva

apparatuswrap.APP: 6c manojavair a- NKA12NK28NKo77GP74; manoramair na NC45, manoramyair a- NK82E, manojajaivar GP43cm
apparatuswrap.TR:
He will have fun for an imperishable time with countless auspicious [flying] chariots,
furnished with everything he desires, swift as thought.

apparatuswrap.APP:
7a paramāṣṭaguṇaiśvaryair ∑; paramāṣṭaguṇamaiśvaryar NKo77cm
7b sarvataḥ msNGP43; samataḥ GP74

7c sarvajñaḥ ∑; sarvajña NKA12 •
paripūrṇātmā msNGP74; paripūrṇaś ca GP43
7d dvitīya ∑; dvitīyam NKo77
apparatuswrap.TR: He will be endowed with the sovereignty of the supreme eight qualities, powerful on everything, omniscient, fully satisfied, like a second Śaṅkara.
As the supreme Lord is supreme among all immortals, in the same way the gift of knowledge is acknowledged as supreme among all gifts.

The one who, having placed, in exact accordance with this procedure,
the manuscript of the knowledge of Śiva in a house of flowers, will worship it in the hermitage of Śiva,

In the day of full moon of the month āṣāḍha, in the light of garlands of lamps, and having done worship in the day of full moon in the month
Vaiśākha as well, this person will take the fruit of a gift of knowledge

apparatuswrap.TR:
Listen to the fruit resulting from the merits of that person who,
having transcribed the best among the auspicious manuscripts, would present [it]
to someone who is versed in the knowledge of Śiva:

As big is the number of this [manuscript’s] extremely auspicious leaves in the manuscript,
for so many thousand yugas he is honoured in the world of Śiva;

Having presented, according to [his] faith and wealth, even just one of the auxiliary instruments of knowledge — which [are] leaves, stands, threads and so on, ink-pot
and pen, a śarayantra seat, unguents, beds, good food, a salary, and so on,

apparatuswrap.TR: — He is honoured in the world of Śiva with great enjoyments.

apparatuswrap.TR:
Having donated a carpet for the manuscript and a beautiful cloth, proportionate to
the measures [of the manuscript], or a cover for its box, he is honoured in the
world of Śiva.

As many are the whole number of threads in the cloth of this [manuscript], for so
many thousand yugas he will obtain great enjoyments

apparatuswrap.TR: One who offers a gift of food to one who is versed in the knowledge of Śiva will take the fruit of a gift of knowledge without interruption, until the end.

The one who would regularly do this for five people whose souls rejoice in the
Śaiva knowledge, for five years, this one will obtain the fruit of the gift of knowledge.
